basic.description:
Methods and theory for ordinary and partial differential equations; separation of variables in rectangular and cylindrical coordinate systems; sinusoidal and Bethel orthogonal functions; the wave, diffusion, and Laplace¿s equation; Sturn-Liouville theory; Fourier transform and Laplace transform techniques.
LEARNING HOURS    118 (36L;12T;70P)
basic.subject: MATH
basic.title: Fourier Methods for Boundary Value Problems

extra.enrollment_requirement: Prerequisite     (MATH221 or MATH280) and (MATH232 or MATH231) and (MATH110 or MATH111).
